title: World's Largest Urban Population
description: In 2024, China had a staggering 451 million people living in urban agglomerations of more than 1 million, highlighting its rapid urbanization.

title: Leading Global Trade Surplus
description: In 2023, China achieved a net trade surplus of $593.9 billion, showcasing its dominance in global trade.

title: Top Railway Freight Transporter
description: In 2019, China transported 3,018 million ton-km of goods via railways, leading the world in railway freight.

title: High Short-Term Debt Ratio
description: In 2023, short-term debt constituted 53.19% of China's total external debt, indicating potential financial vulnerability.

title: Massive Total Reserves
description: By 2024, China's total reserves, including gold, reached $3.26 trillion, underscoring its financial strength.

title: High Carbon Dioxide Damage Costs
description: In 2021, China incurred $482.5 billion in carbon dioxide damage, reflecting significant environmental challenges.

title: Robust Gross Savings
description: In 2023, China's gross savings amounted to $7.76 trillion, highlighting its strong saving culture.

title: Significant Health Expenditure Impact on Poverty
description: In 2018, 28.61% of China's population was pushed below the poverty line due to out-of-pocket health expenses, indicating healthcare affordability issues.

title: High Liner Shipping Connectivity
description: In 2021, China scored 171.18 on the liner shipping connectivity index, leading the world in maritime trade connectivity.

title: Extensive Inventory Changes
description: In 2023, China experienced inventory changes worth $131.67 billion, reflecting dynamic economic adjustments.

title: Low Net Primary Income
description: In 2023, China's net primary income was recorded at -$148.24 billion, indicating a significant outflow of income from the country.

title: Minimal Net Errors and Omissions
description: China's net errors and omissions in 2023 amounted to -$37.93 billion, reflecting discrepancies in balance of payments data.

title: Negative Bilateral Aid Flows
description: In 2022, China experienced negative bilateral aid flows from several DAC donors, totaling -$126.74 million, indicating more aid given than received.

title: High Debt from Bonds and Lending
description: China's debt from bonds and commercial lending reached -$60.33 billion in 2023, highlighting significant financial obligations.

title: Low Official Development Assistance Received
description: In 2022, China received -$282.32 million in net official development assistance, indicating limited external financial aid.

title: Small Urban Population in Largest City
description: As of 2024, only 3.24% of China's urban population resides in the largest city, suggesting a more distributed urban population.

title: Low National Poverty Headcount Ratio
description: In 2019, only 0.6% of China's population lived below the national poverty line, reflecting significant poverty reduction efforts.

title: Minimal International Migrant Stock
description: In 2015, international migrants constituted just 0.07% of China's population, indicating low levels of immigration.

title: Low Early Marriage Rate for Women
description: In 2020, only 0.1% of women aged 20-24 in China were married by age 15, showcasing progress in gender equality.

title: Minimal Battle-Related Deaths
description: In 2023, China recorded only 1 battle-related death, indicating a peaceful domestic environment.
